Updated November     pm





Sen PERIOD Jon Tester speaks in Brantly Hall in Oct PERIOD  PERIOD

People eagerly swarmed the Presidents Room in Brantly Hall on the University of Montana campus waiting the arrival of the man of the hour on Friday PERIOD

Visitors to campus arrived with white signs reading  and proudly displaying blue stickers donning the senators name PERIOD They all waited excitedly for Sen PERIOD Jon Tester to arrive and give his speech PERIOD

Despite keeping the visit mildly secret Tester was greeted by nearly  people PERIOD The campaign chose to not have the visit to campus previewed due to the lack of space available in the rooms Tester held events said Andrea Helling Testers communications director PERIOD

Melissa Rees a senior theater major said she heard about the event through the Wilderness Association on campus PERIOD Rees said she came because she wanted to hear an update on the Forest Jobs and Recreation bill straight from the senator PERIOD

 she said PERIOD

Testers speech was preceded by speeches from Loren Rose of Pyramid Mountain Lumber Connie Long coowner and operator of Bob Marshall Wildertness Outfitters and Rebecca Boslough a student at UM PERIOD They talked about the importance of the Forest Jobs and Recreation Act to the logging industry wilderness preservation and the preservation of Montanas heritage through the protection of landmarks and natural beauty PERIOD

Tester said the bill is pivotal because it will protect Montanas best places to hunt fish and hike by creating permanent new recreation areas and it creates jobs by 

 he said PERIOD 

Tester asked the audiences to get involved and help him get the bill over the finish line PERIOD



The senator reminded the audience that writing to the congressional delegation matters PERIOD He also said the college student vote means a lot in every election because they will  in the near future PERIOD 

Tester who has visited the UM campus multiple times during this election season said it is important to have these talks on campus to pique students interest in legislation that affects them PERIOD

 Tester said PERIOD
